entity46.name: wood surface

entity47.name: insects

entity49.description: A type of lemur, known for its unique foraging behavior and specialized adaptations.

entity50.name: primates

entity51.name: animal kingdom
entity51.description: The animal kingdom is a taxonomic rank that includes all multicellular, eukaryotic organisms classified as animals.

entity52.name: regenerative abilities
entity52.description: The capability of an organism to regenerate lost or damaged body parts.

entity53.name: powerful punches
entity53.description: A physical characteristic that allows certain animals to deliver strong blows, often used for defense or hunting.

entity54.name: protective armor
entity54.description: Structures such as shells, scales, or thick skin that protect an organism from physical harm.

entity55.name: specialized foraging techniques
entity55.description: Specific methods used by animals to find and collect food, adapted to their environment and diet.

entity56.name: scientists
entity56.description: Professionals who conduct scientific research and experiments to understand natural phenomena.

entity57.name: Earth
